All I have to say is crab rangoons! Woowee are they delicious!

Baked good are superb, especially the pies... the Dutch apple is so good! And they have a little wine shop that sells wine specifically for them. They have a green apple around St. Patty's day that is terrific and the strawberry is pretty darn good too!
The baked goods are so good. I tried the chocolate chip cookie brownie, wow! Phenomenal! The pies are awesome! Hubby got the pecan and loved it!
Blueberry bread, omg! Moist and yummy! Like a ginormous muffin!
Fried zucchini strips were really good and they didn't skimp on them. Got a box full! :)
Awesome massages!
Who doesn't love a smiley cookie! And Eat N' Park has the best!
Oh those Smiley cookies!!
Smiley cookies and smiley gear... I love it!
Banana nut muffins, wow, yummy! First time I tried them today
Chili dog is wonderful and the plains are fab too! Quick, cheap, & delicious! Awesome dogs!
Prestogeorge = Awesome coffee!
Mmmmmm...Kona! So light and smooth...costs a bit but worth it!
I think every Pittsburgher was here today for the car show. They had two lines open for ticket scanning... ugh. Too busy!
Yummy! The dining room is warm and inviting! The wait staff is friendly and prompt. The food is delicious! Love, love, love their soda pop bread!!!

Blueberry pancakes are always light, fluffy, and loaded with blueberries... hash brown casserole-yummy, and turkey sausage....always hits the spot on a cool, late summer day:) And service is always fantastic-fast & friendly!
Blueberry pancakes! YUM! And we always have phenomenal service!
Love mini golf although the tropical course was closed for maintenance (bummer)
Oh, Oakmont Bakery, how do I love thee...

If you are ever anywhere near Oakmont, you must stop! I stop first thing and, oh my...the smell, heavenly aromas of baked goodies and so pleasing to the eye. Try a cupcake with attitude or Oakmonter bar or just a french toast bagel...I have never been disappointed!

Stopped on my way to work to pick up goodies for NYE. I can't say enough about how good this place is. Even their day old items are fresh and delicious! Got a cake, chocolate chip cookie cake, peanut butter blossoms, nut rolls, and pepperoni bread. Just doesn't get any better! Yummy! Yummy! Yummy! Everything I have had is terrific! If you love sweets, Oakmont Bakery you must try!

Nothing better on a frigid winter day...we tried the paczki for the first time...omg! They are best described as a filled, fluffy,  light, wonderful donut. They come with all sorts of fillings and all we tried were fabulous! They included lemon, blueberry, maple bacon, Pittsburgh, Oakmont, and apple...wow! Also got cupcakes of course, opposites attract is the bestest followed closely by cuppacino.
Is it bad that I have gone two Fridays in a row?
If you go the day before a holiday expect a long line. On the bright side, it went fast:)
The fastest way to get what you want from your secretaries...:) butter them up on admin assistant day! Thank you Steve! You found my weakness!
Yummy stuff. Got a few things and thought the cherry tart was the best but everything was good.

Boxty, a potato pancake with smoked salmon and dill sauce (they have others as well)...delightful! Just the right mix of salty from the smoked salmon and a wonderful dill sauce with a mild potato pancake, terrific! Good food in a wonderful. Irish pub including soccer on all the televisions...awesome!
Now open, at the shops at Northway
The macaroons are just amazing!
FYI...they are on Babcock Blvd now. I did notify Yelp and it has not changed

Delivery always faster than they tell you and the pizza is always hot!
Hubby got a steak. It was cooked to perfection! I got salmon. It was all right, a little overcooked. Rice and grilled veggies were good. Bread is always a treat and we had an excellent waitress.

Just as good as last time!

What a great day to be at the park! Wonderful weather today and fall is here. *sigh* I love fall! Just be careful as they are working on Ingomar road and the lake loop is a bit tore up but still usable.
Puppy park! Our puppy loves the doggie park.
A great day for 2 loops :)
It was a beautiful morning for 7 miles:)

To those drivers using the park as a thru way, please slow down! And please don't have road rage at those of us that slow down and go the speed limit. There are runners, walkers, bikers, and deer, please go 25!
Poochies in the pool was a blast! Held on Labor Day, the pups get to swim in the pool. Hope it becomes a yearly thing, total blast!
Poochies in the pool, $20 to register at the gate for 1 dog and 1 human. Preregister and it is cheaper. Benefited Paws across Pittsburgh. And so worth it!
It's like spring, get out and enjoy!!!!

Tofu...never a huge fan until I had it here...
Cranberry sage margarita is delightful!

Yummy fajitas and chimichangas. Chips and salsa are great. And the margaritas, fantastic. Went Saturday to celebrate my best friend's bday and had a blast! Good food, good drinks, wonderful service,  and best of all great company!
A must if you are just visiting! And even if you are a long time resident always nice to visit again and again
Love the tuna! :) bread is warm and fresh and awesome too! And even when you get take out, it comes out right and they package it so you can get it all home without having a mess.

Incredibly disappointed in the food tonight. Tuna was WAY overdone. Asked for rare and got well done :( got the margarita flatbread and the middle was drenched with oil and it tasted under done and cold. And the red peppers and other veggies tasted canned. Not their best showing. Incredibly disappointed!!!!

I love Primanti's. Niece wanted to go for her birthday & who are we to deny her:) I just wish I did not have to cut my own sandwich. I really don't like that, at all. They let us bring in her birthday cake and were very accommodating to our large 9 person party. What a great way to celebrate our niece's 15th (ugh, I feel old) birthday!

Just all right. My chicken was a little overdone. The hubby got the steak and it was good, just as he asked. The waitress was terrific though and the best part of the evening was spending time with our family:)

Instead, I got this.  First, the weight was way too light.  Skimpy, taste-free meat with too-thin sauce, wrapped in softened cardboard.  I gave it a shot, I really did, but it was SO not worth the price.

Why Ship Your Car When You Can Drive?

I am so glad you asked. When you drive your car long distances you are doing more than filling your gas tank. You are increasing your mileage and decreasing the value of your car, decreasing the life of your engine, tires and other critical parts, increasing the chances of an accident significantly. It may even seem cheaper on the surface to fill up your tank and go, but as you can see, we are the affordable alternative to costly wear and tear on your car.

Just like in any business, if you provide excellent service, clients prefer to deal with you over others , that's why Autoland of Pittsburgh added few more new trucks and trailers ... are YOU getting your cars and trucks on time ? Most likely not if they are not on our trailers .

Auto Shipping For Snowbirds

Here at Autoland of Pittsburgh  , we specialize in auto shipping for snowbirds. 
It takes a company with a vast network of drivers to be able to get your vehicle picked up professionally, safely, and on time.  Whether you winter in Florida, Arizona, or another tropical location, WE has the resources to take good care of your vehicle.
Promotional pricing to make shipping your vehicle as affordable as possible, Use code GO PENS 2017 when you call.

If you order a burger with "onion jam", #1: order it on the side, otherwise, your bottom bun will be soggy and fall apart. #2: Don't  expect any "jam"-- just sauteed onions. Still, they're tasty. I've had 4 burgers with onion jam, and there's  no jam.

Thanks to Stripes program, my Bownie Obsession is free! Cool beans!

Being in legal field (got an A in Contract Law), I beg of you: READ EVERY SINGLE WORD IN CONTRACT. Daughter's states teacher must be notified 2 days prior for any change or cancellation. NO exceptions. So, if you or kid is suddenly sick/ injured, or if there's a family death, you still pay. Try to negotiate something fair and equitable for both parties. If the answer is "Absolutely not!", then feel free to look elsewhere.

The WPHS desperately needs donations: pillows, plastic bags, newspaper, blankets, toilet paper tubes, animal toys, our time! Of course, monetary donations are ALWAYS welcome!

It's K.S.--Kitten Season, and there are a LOT of really nice, beautiful kitties that desperately need their "Furever" home. Come on, Yelpers, we can pull this off, and knock down the number of kitties up for adoption! We are a bunch of big-hearted animal lovers! Since 1986, I've adopted 6 homeless cats. Worst dental experience of my life!  Save yourself time, money and ALOT of pain and find a qualified dentist! They are scam artists and I unfortunately found out why their nickname is the Butcher! I now have to see a specialist in hopes that he can make my mouth look somewhat normal!  I went in for a routine cleaning and was told I needed 2 root canals and an extraction.  Had the extraction done - he ripped the tooth out thru the bone and side of my gums!  I had pain for 3 weeks!  Horrible!!

I received a bill from this place for almost $1700.00!  I immediately called and was told that my insurance did not cover any procedures that were performed and myself or my husband!  So I called my insurance company.  Not one claim for the procedures were submitted!  I had to pay $249.00 for a bone graft. My current dentist is not even sure they did a bone graft as I have pretty much no bone where the tooth was extracted.  I will get a refund!!!  Reported to the BBB!!!

I was also instructed that I needed to have a ton of root canals done and then crowns would need to be completed.  They also wanted me to return in one week after the extraction to start a bridge for the extracted tooth.  The area needs 6 - 8 weeks to heal before a bridge can be completed.  I went to my new/old dentist today who told me that I do not need all those root canals!!!  Now I have to see an oral surgeon to see if he can even repair the damage done so I can get a bridge!!!
Wrong tooth was worked on and we were charged 1000 dollars due to an error insurance should of covered! Stole our money and did poor work!

Gordon Bethune and Continental please come back and save us!!!!!

But if anything, just get a 4 cut when trying anything new  .
